verses.verse: Cry <WH7121> aloud<WH1627>, spare<WH2820> not<WH7311>, lift up thy voice<WH6963> like a trumpet<WH7782>, and declare<WH5046> unto my people<WH5971> their transgression<WH6588>, and to the house<WH1004> of Jacob<WH3290> their sins<WH2403>.

Yet they seek<WH1875> me daily<WH3117>, and delight<WH2654> to know<WH1847> my ways<WH1870>: as a nation<WH1471> that did<WH6213> righteousness<WH6666>, and forsook<WH5800> not the ordinance<WH4941> of their God<WH430>, they ask<WH7592> of me righteous<WH4941> judgments<WH6664>; they delight<WH2654> to draw near<WH7132> unto God<WH430>.

Wherefore have we fasted<WH6684>, say they<WH7200>, and thou seest not<WH6031>? wherefore have we afflicted our soul<WH5315>, and thou takest no knowledge<WH3045>? Behold<WH3117>, in the day of your fast<WH6685> ye find<WH4672> your own pleasure<WH2656>, and exact<WH5065> all your labors<WH6092>.

Behold <WH6684>, ye fast for strife<WH7379> and contention<WH7379>, and to smite<WH5221> with the fist<WH106> of wickedness<WH7562>: ye fast<WH6684> not this day<WH3117> so as to make your voice<WH6963> to be heard<WH8085> on high<WH4791>.

Is such the fast<WH6685> that I have chosen<WH977>? the day<WH3117> for a man<WH120> to afflict<WH6031> his soul<WH5315>? Is it to bow down<WH3721> his head<WH7218> as a rush<WH100>, and to spread<WH3331> sackcloth<WH8242> and ashes<WH665> under him<WH7121>? wilt thou call this<WH2088> a fast<WH6685>, and an acceptable<WH7522> day<WH3117> to Jehovah<WH3068>?

Is not this the fast<WH6685> that I have chosen<WH977>: to loose<WH6605> the bonds<WH2784> of wickedness<WH7562>, to undo<WH5425> the bands<WH92> of the yoke<WH4133>, and to let the oppressed<WH7533> go<WH7971> free<WH2670>, and that ye break<WH5423> every yoke<WH4133>?

Is it not to deal<WH6536> thy bread<WH3899> to the hungry<WH7457>, and that thou bring<WH935> the poor<WH6041> that are cast out<WH4788> to thy house<WH1004>? when thou seest<WH7200> the naked<WH6174>, that thou cover<WH3680> him<WH5956>; and that thou hide not thyself from thine own flesh<WH1320>?

Then shall thy light<WH216> break forth<WH1234> as the morning<WH7837>, and thy healing<WH724> shall spring forth<WH6779> speedily<WH4120>; and thy righteousness<WH6664> shall go<WH1980> before<WH6440> thee<WH3519>; the glory of Jehovah<WH3068> shall by thy rearward<WH622>.

Then shalt thou call<WH7121>, and Jehovah<WH3068> will answer<WH6030>; thou shalt cry<WH7768>, and he will say<WH559>, Here I am<WH5493>. If thou take away from the midst<WH8432> of thee the yoke<WH4133>, the putting forth<WH7971> of the finger<WH676>, and speaking<WH1696> wickedly<WH205>;

and if thou draw out<WH6329> thy soul<WH5315> to the hungry<WH7457>, and satisfy<WH7646> the afflicted<WH6031> soul<WH5315>: then shall thy light<WH216> rise<WH2224> in darkness<WH653>, and thine obscurity<WH2822> be as the noonday<WH6672>;

and Jehovah<WH3068> will guide<WH5148> thee continually<WH8548>, and satisfy<WH7646> thy soul<WH5315> in dry<WH6710> places<WH2502>, and make strong thy bones<WH6106>; and thou shalt be like a watered<WH7302> garden<WH1588>, and like a spring<WH4161> of water<WH4325>, whose waters<WH4325> fail not<WH3576>.

And they that shall be of thee shall build<WH1129> the old<WH5769> waste places<WH2723>; thou shalt raise up<WH6965> the foundations<WH4146> of many<WH1755> generations<WH1755>; and thou shalt be called<WH7121> The repairer<WH1443> of the breach<WH6556>, The restorer<WH7725> of paths<WH5410> to dwell in<WH3427>.

If thou turn away<WH7725> thy foot<WH7272> from the sabbath<WH7676>, from doing<WH6213> thy pleasure<WH2656> on my holy<WH6944> day<WH3117>; and call<WH7121> the sabbath<WH7676> a delight<WH6027>, and the holy<WH6918> of Jehovah<WH3068> honorable<WH3513>; and shalt honor<WH3513> it<WH6213>, not doing thine own ways<WH1870>, nor finding<WH4672> thine own pleasure<WH2656>, nor speaking<WH1696> thine own words<WH1697>:

then shalt thou delight<WH6026> thyself in Jehovah<WH3068>; and I will make thee to ride<WH7392> upon the high places<WH1116> of the earth<WH776>; and I will feed<WH398> thee with the heritage<WH5159> of Jacob<WH3290> thy father<WH1>: for the mouth<WH6310> of Jehovah<WH3068> hath spoken it<WH1696>.
